page.title: 09THE VILLAGE OF OUSTON
page.content: The village of{OUSTON}has been growing since the early 1960's from the original pit village based on the local colliery (long since closed) to a large modern residential area of some{TWO THOUSAND}homes.The older surviving properties in and around { {THE BROOMS}and{NORTH VIEW}(many of which are still rented from the local authority) effectively form a central hub around which the newer and almost without exception the privately owned properties have been built. The first phase of development by the Newcastle based firm of WILLIAM LEECH - the{WENTWORTH PARK estate}- is now some 20 years old. The most recent development - the{GRANGE VILLAGE {complex}- is still being built and should complete the whole project in the near future.
